Sentencas: Discovering new materials that efficiently catalyze the oxygen reduction and evolution reactions is critical for facilitating the widespread adoption of solid oxide fuel cell and electrolyzer (SOFC/SOEC) technologies.
Titulo: Machine Learning Design of Perovskite Catalytic Properties

Sentencas: Here, machine learning (ML) models are developed to predict perovskite catalytic properties critical for SOFC/SOEC applications, including oxygen surface exchange, oxygen diffusivity, and area specific resistance (ASR).
Titulo: Machine Learning Design of Perovskite Catalytic Properties

Sentencas: The models are based on trivial-to-calculate elemental features and are more accurate and dramatically faster than the best models based on ab initio-derived features, potentially eliminating the need for ab initio calculations in descriptor-based screening.
Titulo: Machine Learning Design of Perovskite Catalytic Properties

Sentencas: The model of ASR enables temperature-dependent predictions, has well calibrated uncertainty estimates and online accessibility.
Titulo: Machine Learning Design of Perovskite Catalytic Properties

Sentencas: Use of temporal cross-validation reveals the model to be effective at discovering new promising materials prior to their initial discovery, demonstrating the model can make meaningful predictions.
Titulo: Machine Learning Design of Perovskite Catalytic Properties

Sentencas: Using the SHapley Additive ExPlanations (SHAP) approach, detailed discussion of different approaches of model featurization is provided for ML property prediction.
Titulo: Machine Learning Design of Perovskite Catalytic Properties

Sentencas: Finally, the model is used to screen more than 19 million perovskites to develop a list of promising cheap, earth-abundant, stable, and high performing materials, and find some top materials contain mixtures of less-explored elements (e.g., K, Bi, Y, Ni, Cu) worth exploring in more detail.
Titulo: Machine Learning Design of Perovskite Catalytic Properties
